featuredItems.title: CANOPY-TOP MEASUREMENTS DO NOT ACCURATELY QUANTIFY CANOPY-SCALE LEAF THERMOREGULATION
featuredItems.description: Spectral tuning of visual pigments often facilitates adaptation to new environments, and it is intriguing to study the visual ecology of pelagic sharks with secondarily expanded habitats.
featuredItems.author: Marco Antonio Lopez
